page.title: 01Geology
page.content:
Running almost diagonally across the area is the dividing line between on the lower right, Silurian Bannisdale Slates and Coniston Grits, and on the upper left, Ordivician Borrowdale Volcanics. Along this line are also to be found small intrusions of Coniston Limestone where may be found many fossil corals in the Appletreeworth region. In the Borrowdale Volcanics there have been many small mininmg trials for both copper and iron. In the Bannisdale slates and the volcanics may be found countless quarries and mines for slate.
See "The Geology of the Lake District" (1978) Ed. F. Mosely. Pub. by The Yorkshire Geological Society.
